name: Abelian extension
rephrased: An abelian extension is a type of field extension that is Galois (meaning it is a normal and separable extension) and has an abelian group of symmetries (the Galois group).
implication_form: If a field extension is Galois and its Galois group is abelian, then it is an abelian extension.
explained: An abelian extension is a Galois extension where the Galois group is abelian. A cyclic extension is a specific type of abelian extension where the Galois group is cyclic. Solvable extensions are Galois extensions with a solvable Galois group, which includes all abelian extensions (since abelian groups are solvable) but is a broader category.
